--- title: Steel defect detection use case keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "A walk through different solutions for the Severstal Kaggle competition." description: "A walk through different solutions for the Severstal Kaggle competition." nb_path: "nbs/index.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This repository wants to explore different solutions for the Severstal competition (ended in November 2019).

I used pytorch (Pytorch website) and fastai (FastAI docs) as Deep Learning Framework to this project.

Install

To install this package you only need to clone the repository and install via pip:

git clone https://github.com/marcomatteo/steel_segmentation.git
pip install -e steel_segmentation

Developing

To set up the developer enviroment to build the package or try different Deep Learning models using this repository, follow these commands:

conda create -n env_nbdev
conda activate env_nbdev
conda install -c fastai -c pytorch fastai
conda install -c conda-forge jupyter_contrib_nbextensions
git clone https://github.com/fastai/nbdev
pip install -e nbdev
git clone https://github.com/marcomatteo/steel_segmentation.git
cd steel_segmentation
pip install -e .
nbdev_install_git_hooks
jupyter notebook

If there's some issues with nbdev, try to uninstall with pip uninstall nbdev and install again with pip install nbdev. Now you can edit the Jupyter Notebook files.

To edit the .py modules in steel_segmentation you need to modify the Jupyter Notebooks inside the nbs folder (in the notebooks, only cells starting with #exp will be exported to the modules) and create the relative documentation, run:

nbdev_build_lib
nbdev_build_docs

Hint: this repository is build on nbdev. For more infos check the nbdev repository.

NB: I tried to work in MacOS and Linux enviroment, not sure this is working also in Windows.

Requirements

You will need the Kaggle competition data. If this is the first time with the API, follow this link and download the credentials.

Copy the kaggle.json file in the repository directory.

{% raw %} 
!mkdir ~/.kaggle
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
!cp ../kaggle.json ~/.kaggle/kaggle.json
{% endraw %}

Now you're authenticated with the Kaggle API. Download and unzip the data with:

{% raw %} 
!kaggle competitions download -c severstal-steel-defect-detection -p {path}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
!unzip -q -n {path}/severstal-steel-defect-detection.zip -d {path}
{% endraw %}

Finally you can install the package with:

git clone https://github.com/marcomatteo/steel_segmentation.git
pip install -e steel_segmentation
